conclusion: Analyze electric field and potential at center O of triangle with charges at A, B, and C.
Equilateral triangle with vertices A, B, and C; equal magnitude like charges at A and B.
Electric field at center O is E, directed towards charges.
Electric field due to each charge at O calculated using E = kq/r^2.
Distance from any vertex to center O is (sqrt(3)/3) times side length.
Fields E_A and E_B at O are equal in magnitude but opposite in direction.
Net field at O is E_net = E_A + E_B = 2E.
E = 2E_A cos(30Â°) = sqrt(3) E_A, so E_A = E/sqrt(3).
Place opposite charge at C; field at O is opposite to fields at A and B.
Magnitude of field due to charge at C is E_C = E/sqrt(3).
Net electric field at O is E_net = E_A + E_B + E_C = E/sqrt(3).
Electric potential at a point due to a charge is V = kq/r.
Total potential V at O is V_A + V_B + V_C.
